intro: Leandra scabra, commonly known as the rough leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. Leandra scabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
